messages.message: Hey Austria, just dropping in to say hello. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I think an Austria-turkey alliance would work well, since I’ve seen *WAY* to many games where Russia is left to their own devices and all of the sudden have half the board. Anyways, good luck and have fun!
messages.input: Message from ENGLAND:'Hey Austria, just dropping in to say hello. Our paths probably won’t cross for a while, but may I suggest you attack Russia? I think an Austria-turkey alliance would work well, since I’ve seen *WAY* to many games where Russia is left to their own devices and all of the sudden have half the board. Anyways, good luck and have fun!'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message from ENGLAND. The suggestion to attack Russia could be a tactic to divert your attention away, potentially allowing England to benefit from your conflict with Russia.

messages.message: I wish you luck as well.  perhaps we can work together further into the game.
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'I wish you luck as well.  perhaps we can work together further into the game.'.

messages.message: So.. what are you thinking about Russia? I would hate to see them run off with the game this early on... especially because turkey doesn't seem like the most competent player.
messages.input: Message from ENGLAND:'So.. what are you thinking about Russia? I would hate to see them run off with the game this early on... especially because turkey doesn't seem like the most competent player.'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message from ENGLAND. The attempt to sow doubt about Turkey's competence and push you towards attacking Russia could be a strategy to weaken both your positions while England benefits from the conflict.

messages.message: I am honestly undecided.  Russia had a nice first turn, but we also agreed on a good neutral territory and that promise was kept so.. I like people who are trustworthy
messages.input: My response to ENGLAND:'I am honestly undecided.  Russia had a nice first turn, but we also agreed on a good neutral territory and that promise was kept so.. I like people who are trustworthy'.
